requirement: The areas having storage, manufacturing, hazardous activities such as paint store, oil storage, spray booths, etc, shall be separated from non-hazardous areas like administrative office, staff canteen, etc by fire rated walls/doors of 120 min fire resistance rating.
The fire resistance rating of high hazardous areas like petrochemical, explosives shall be 240 min.

The separating wall shall be carried through the roof. The screen wall shall be of not less than 230 mm in thickness if it is an extension of a masonry wall, and not less than 150 mm in thickness if it is an extension of a reinforced concrete wall.

Doors and window openings in external walls within 3 m of the fire separating walls shall be protected by fire doors having a rating of at least 60 min and window openings may be protected by fire resistant glass assembly having same fire rating.
Storage areas shall be separated from the remainder of the building/block by fire walls.

In any room in which volatile flammable substances  are  used  or  stored,  no  device generating a glow or flame capable of igniting flammable vapour shall be installed or used, such a room shall be provided with a suitably designed  exhaust  ventilation  system as per Annex M.
Fire protection considerations for venting industrial occupancies shall be as in Annex M.
